Getting Started

Getting Started with Swiftpol

Welcome to the Swiftpol documentation! This guide will help you get started with using Swiftpol for polymer molecular dynamics simulations.

Installation

To install Swiftpol, you can use pip. Run the following command in your terminal:

`bash pip install swiftpol `

Alternatively, you can clone the repository and install it locally:

`bash git clone https://github.com/<username>/swiftpol.git cd swiftpol pip install . `

Usage

Build a short PEG chain using Swiftpol:

```python from swiftpol import build from rdkit.Chem import AllChem

build.build_polymer(‘AAAA’,

[‘IOCCOI’], # Iodine is used to mark reaction sites AllChem.ReactionFromSmarts(‘[C:1]-[O:2]-[I:3].[C:4]-[O:5]-[I:6]>>[C:1]-[O:2]-[C:4].[I:3][O:5][I:6]’)

)
